title: After School Program Coordinator and Assistant Teacher
description:
**We are hiring an After School Program Coordinator for our new school we are opening in the Wilton, CT area. Apply today to join our founding team!**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


### **Overview of Role**



As an After School Program Coordinator, you will lead the introduction and implementation of new curriculum to our current extended day (after school) programming while you continue to work directly with children and fulfill your responsibilities as an Assistant Teacher. You will have the opportunity to oversee and execute all program logistics, ranging from the scheduling of different activities, supervision of staff involvement, curriculum practices, procurement of materials, and ensuring the ultimate success of the afternoon.



The After School Program Coordinator should be an extremely organized and responsible individual. This individual will not only lead the lesson plans but provide guidance to the children and other extended day staff. Please note that during the extended day program, you will be working "in ratio" leading and personally executing the program.


### **Reporting Structure**



The After School Program Coordinator will report to the Head of School and will work on a consistent basis to improve and enhance our extended care program.


### **Training Requirements**



The Prepared Montessorian provides a training to be completed in preparation for the role. We have developed a framework of enrichment activities and curriculum to be incorporated into extended day scheduling in our Toddler and Children's House classrooms! The curriculum includes beautiful albums of age-appropriate culinary arts, purposeful movement for outdoors and indoors, and exploration of different art forms to engage children in creative learning. We are now offering an exciting opportunity for an Assistant Guide to lead the program in our classrooms!


### **Time Commitment**



The After School Program Coordinator will work 9:30am till 6:00pm daily, with an hour of daily prep time integrated into a daily schedule including time supporting in the classrooms during the normal academic day. The After School Program Coordinator will prepare daily activities for the extended day time period, running from 3:00pm till 6:00pm, and will mentor other guides in executing the planned activities. Active participation during extended care is very important and the Extended Day Coordinator will oversee the day to day operations until closing each day. Please consider your schedule and the required time commitment carefully prior to applying for this position.


### **Compensation**



The After School Program Coordinator will earn a stipend for taking on the additional responsibilities and ownership. Please note that this position will not require any extra time commitment outside of the 40-hour work week that full time Guides work.



Core Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


* Responsibilities of a Guide
* Participate in training sessions with Prepared Montessorian
* Implement new curriculums across multiple classrooms and guide extended day staff in the execution of lesson plans and activities
* Organize, schedule, and lead activities and staff during extended care
* Prepare and procure required materials for lesson plans
* Introduce new lesson plans to children
* Create weekly newsletter to share planned activities with families
* Ensure the overall success of extended day programming and create a sense of community!
* Be a supportive and positive leader!
* During the pre-open phase, you may support with administrative functions including: Front desk operations and family engagement

 ### **Qualifications**


* Meet Head Teacher requirements:
	+ At least 6 months of experience working with children AND
	+ A CDA or 12 credits in early childhood education OR
	+ A Bachelor's degree in early childhood education
* Experience working with preschool-aged children
* Extremely organized, detail oriented, and responsible individual

  





### **About Us**



Guidepost Montessori is a growing network of 100+ Montessori schools, serving children ages 0-12 in our Nido, Toddler, Children's House, and Elementary programs. And with schools from Shanghai to Paris and California to New York, as well as virtual school and homeschooling support, there are countless opportunities for passionate educators to support children on their individual path to success.  

  

At Guidepost, we believe children are capable and we design an education for independence. We're on a mission to radically transform education based on this belief—for children, parents, and educators!



Our mission? Children who fully experience and joyfully achieve their own development; children who can reach their highest potential and flourish—in school and in life!


**If you love children and have been looking for the right opportunity to grow, join our school community by applying below!**


*Higher Ground Education, Guidepost Montessori, and Academy of Thought and Industry are committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO). We will not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under applicable federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Our leadership is dedicated to ensuring the fulfillment of this policy. When requested, we are committed to reasonably accommodate employees and applicants with disabilities or special needs that may require an accommodation.*

title: Warehouse Team Lead
description:
**Overview:**

The Warehouse Team Lead assigns work to warehouse personnel, provides on the job training and feedback, champions safety awareness and ensures jobs are completed correctly and efficiently. In addition, the team lead brings excellent performers and those requiring correction to the attention of management, assists in scheduling and reporting by planning and organizing work schedules to ensure jobs are assigned correctly and efficiently. Coordinates unloading/loading of inbound/outbound shipments in accordance with procedures, and ensures inventory controls are maintained. Provides warehouse services assigned through safe, efficient, cost effective and accurate handling of customer products.

Responsibilities

**Responsibilities:** 

This position is responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

* Coordinate unloading/loading of inbound/outbound shipments and staging in accordance with procedures
* Responsible for Inventory Control and Storage thru cycle counts and physical audits.
* Provide support to team involving product damage, quality and safety issues.
* Plan and organize work schedules and ensure jobs are assigned correctly and efficiently.
* Provide support for the Shipping and Receiving Clerk.
* Lead employees on a team basis.
* Ability to cover “shift” responsibilities in Supervisor’s absence.
* Performs job functions of a Material Handler 2 or 3 as directed by the supervisor.
* Provide other services such as housekeeping activities, assembling crates to contain products and/or moving loose materials to containers as directed by supervisor.
* Provide hands on training for associates in all tasks in the department.
* Responsible for safety, sanitation and security through awareness programs, meetings, inspections and preventative measures.
* Complete activity and statistical reports as assigned by supervisor.
* Assist in physical inventories ensuring facility and contents are secure.
* Responsible for reports to management outlining results of these essential functions.

**Key Result Areas:**

* Apply the APL Logistics Continuous Improvement (ACI) Model for operational efficiency to improve business process, increase proficiency and increase efficiency through waste elimination.
* Apply the 5S Lean methodology to sustain a safe, clean and orderly facility.
* sition requires the incumbent’s performance to meet and occasionally exceed standards as set by the company for safety, quality, productivity and customer service.

Qualifications

**Qualifications:** 

* High school diploma or equivalent required
* 1-2 years warehouse or related work experience required
* 2 years Fork Truck/Tow motor operational/material handling skills required
* Equipment Certification required
* Ability to read and comprehend basic instructions, to interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedures
* Ability to write legibly
* Must have basic math, computer and data entry skills
* Ability to make decisions on customer acceptance based on past experience and fitness for use
* Ability to communicate in a professional and positive manner
* Ability to lead others to complete work requirements
* Solid command of English, both written and verbal
* Must have attention to detail for continuous mental and visual attention
* Must be a Team Player

**Additional Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities**

* 1-2 years of Team Lead or related work experience preferred
* Spanish speaking a plus
* Action Oriented
* Results Driven
* Teamwork - showing a commitment to teamwork and collaboration
* Respect - extending dignity and respect to all people
* Integrity - fostering trust and a positive work environment
* Innovation - bringing creativity to the workplace
* Customer Focus - achieving Company, department, and personal goals through a strong customer focus

The hourly wage for this position is $19.75, plus shift differential.

**Candidates are eligible for the following benefits:** 

* PTO
* 6 days sick time
* 8 paid holidays
* 1 paid "Personal Holiday"
* Company Bonus Plan

* Annual Fixed Contribution

* Tuition reimbursement and student loan assistance
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

title: Collections Specialist
description:
At Similarweb, we are revolutionizing the way businesses interact with the digital world by revealing to them everything that happens online.



Our unique data and solutions empower over 4,300 customers globally, including industry giants like Google, eBay, and Adidas, to make game-changing decisions that drive their digital strategies.



In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we continue to reach new heights! Come work alongside Similarwebbers across the globe who are bright, curious, practical and good people.



We are looking for a **Collections Specialist** to join our Finance team!


**So, what will you be doing all day?**


* Daily monitoring of accounts receivable
* Follow up and engage with customers on outstanding payments and resolve any issues causing payment delays
* Resolve invoice discrepancies and disputes
* Work with the book keeping and accounting team to ensure accurate cash application is done in a timely manner and resolve unrecognized payments
* Work closely with the sales and account management team to escalate issues and cooperate on outstanding payments
* Process internal requests for address changes and customer vendor forms


**This is the perfect job for someone who has:**


* Completed a degree in finance/economics/business management preferred
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* 2 years of experience as a Collections or Billing specialist
* Excellent English – written and spoken.
* Ability to follow directions, meet strict deadlines, and work independently
* Thrive in a high intensity work environment and with a large customer portfolio
* Systems: Salesforce, Zuora (Billing) and AR Management tools - a plus


\\*\\*At Similarweb, collaborating with our colleagues in-office creates a more connected, unified culture. Our best work is a product of our face-to-face collaboration, with the ability to work partially from home.\\*\\*



The base salary range for this position in New York City is *$56,480 to $94,710* + benefits including: medical, dental and vision insurance, 401K plan, potential equity, employee stock purchase plan and paid sick and parental leave.



Individual compensation is based upon a number of factors, including qualifications and relevant experience.



The base salary range above is for the New York City metro area, and could vary for candidates in other locations.


**Why you'll love being a Similarwebber:**


**You'll actually love the product you work with:** Our customers aren't our only raving fans. When we asked our employees why they chose to come work at Similarweb, 99% of them said "the product." Imagine how exciting your job is when you get to work with the most powerful digital intelligence platform in the world.


**You'll find a home for your big ideas:** We encourage an open dialogue and empower employees to bring their ideas to the table. You'll find the resources you need to take initiative and create meaningful change within the organization.


**We offer competitive perks & benefits:** We take your well-being seriously, and offer competitive compensation packages to all employees. We also put a strong emphasis on community, with regular team outings and happy hours.


**You can grow your career in any direction you choose:** Interested in becoming a VP or want to transition into a different department? Whether it's Career Week, personalized coaching, or our ongoing learning solutions, you'll find all the tools and opportunities you need to develop your career right here.


**Diversity isn't just a buzzword:** People want to work in a place where they can be themselves. We strive to create a workplace that is reflective of the communities we serve, where everyone is empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to inclusivity across race, gender, ethnicity, culture, sexual orientation, age, religion, spirituality, identity and experience. Our culture of equality and mutual respect also helps us better understand and serve our customers in a world that is becoming more global, more diverse, and more digital every day.


***Please note: We're unable to sponsor employment visas at this time.***


*#LI-DC #LI-Hybrid*


We will handle your application and information related to your application in accordance with the Applicant Privacy Policy available here.

title: Assistant Designer - Men's Knits & Sweaters
description:
**About Rag & Bone**  

  

From our origins in New York in 2002, rag & bone was founded on a belief of uncompromising ideals: a commitment to doing things the right way, not the easy way. To making things that are as original as they are timeless. To being true to ourselves, even when that truth sets us apart from the mainstream.  

  

We still believe in the same principles we started with: the easy elegance of classic British tailoring, the authenticity of American workwear, and the originality of our home city, New York. As New Yorkers, community and authenticity have become synonymous with our brand. An inclusive environment at rag & bone upholds our original values by encouraging employee connection and empowering each individual to have a voice on policy, process, and collaboration for a more equitable future.  

  

**Job Summary**



Rag & Bone is looking for a Men's Design Assistant with background or experience in knits who will support Men's Senior Designer with daily tasks and seasonal projects.


**Responsibilities:**


* Research and prepare materials as directed by director/senior designer
* Follow design direction and design into groups/categories allocated by director/senior designer
* Support design team with ongoing design projects, ie, stitch development and layouts and capsule collections
* Help manage knitdown process
	+ Support team in making sure all knit downs are issued at the correct factory and yarns/trims/fabrics are available for sampling
	+ Input, organize and track all knitdowns issued for the design team
* Support team as needed to organize and prep for meetings, ie: sketch reviews, proto reviews, market reviews – using key dates and calendar set up by directors
* Support team as needed to ensure all samples are correct and organized before passing off to necessary departments
* Responsible for maintaining design boards and overviews, as well as digital boards
* Complete tech packs and design sheets for tech hand offs, making sure they are accurate. Support design team as needed to make sure all designs are issued, ie: layouts, piutch sheets, yarns and swatches etc.
* Take detailed notes during meetings and help organize information to support design team, recap all meetings and keep track accurately all notes from design meetings
* Support design team in updating and maintaining flats and cads based on reviews/fittings and market changes as needed
* Responsible for overseeing all pitch sheets, making sure they are maintained correctly with accurate information


**Requirements:** ***(****skills, qualifications, education, etc)*


* Must have knowledge of Mens apparel
* Passion for knits, sweaters a plus
* Must be extremely organized and have ability to multi-task
* Must have thorough knowledge of Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop


Please submit portfolio with application.


**Rules we live by** | Rules you live by


* **Be a Good Human** - Be original, be authentic. Stand for diversity, equitability & inclusivity.
* **Have No Fear** - Innovate, solve problems
* **Own Every Decision** - Work together, get results
* **Quality Matters** – Not only with product but we see it in our people
* **Make S\\*\\*t Happen** -Be disciplined, be competitive


**Benefits**

* Paid Time Off
* Clothing Allowance
* Generous Employee Discount
* Paid Parental Leave
* Membership to Calm and access to other wellness benefits
* Medical, dental, vision and ancillary benefits
* 401k


*rag & bone is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer. No employee or applicant is discriminated against because of race, color, sex (including pregnancy), age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.*

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.*

title: Dog Walker/Pet Sitter
description:
Tina's Animal Care LLC takes care of all kinds of animals, not just dogs! If you are uncomfortable with any specific animals please let me know. You will be responsible for 15 min, 30min, 45min, and one hour visits. I would love if you are comfortable doing pet transportation as well. You will also occasionally be responsible for meet and greets with the owners and pets before providing services for them to ensure your safety and that its a good fit. I will never make you do anything you are uncomfortable with!

**\\*\\*\\*I am currently only hiring people with previous professional animal experience. Professional animal experience does not include owning your own pets for years or petsitting for friends/family. I need someone that can help me with nervous/aggressive pets and/or people that can administer medications for my medical pets. Thank you for your understanding and for those qualified I look forward to hearing from you!\\*\\*\\***

Payment: Depending on experience level, but you are paid per job, not hourly. Regardless of experience level you are getting **more** than minimum wage. You also can get tips from owners which are 100% yours! I pay you every Friday through Venmo or Zelle and my accountant sends you your paystubs! I will pay you for your training visits, I bring you on 5 appointments with me and you get to keep 25% of my earnings for those visits.

We service Morris County only.

I am willing to split the shifts between two people but I am currently searching for MONDAYS 8-330, THURSDAYS 330-10 FRIDAYS 330-10, and being in the weekend rotation. This does not mean you would be booked the entire time, it is just your availability for the clients to book you. I would also love if I could have someone reliable willing to take on shifts requested outside of your normal hours or to help if another employee calls out. I am moving out of state and won't be able to be backup anymore. My employees are great and super helpful and I would love to have one or two additions to help out while I am away. I am moving in September but you can start as early as you would like. This way I can get you acclimated to clients and "aggressive" animals.

I provide a very accepting, stress free, and positive work experience. I pay well and am extremely flexible when creating your schedule. I really just need reliable workers to help my business out. You will love this job if you are a trustworthy hard worker that loves spending time with animals, and can communicate with the owners efficiently. I need people that have worked with animals before and that have basic understandings of their behaviors and how to handle them. We deal with all animals big and small of all behaviors (again you will not be expected to do something you are uncomfortable with). Here is a quote from one of my employees so you have reassurance coming from someone that works for me rather than me just hyping up my own business:

"I’ve been working for Tina’s Animal Care for close to a year now, and I couldn’t be happier! Each day is filled with joy, the clients - humans and animals alike - are amazing, and Christina is an incredible boss to work with. She is truly kind, compassionate, and wants the best for her employees. The flexibility that Tina offers in this position means I never have to worry about canceling plans or doctor’s appointments because of work. I am thrilled to be able to earn a living working with animals and be part of the incredible team at Tina’s Animal Care. -Laura"

Responsibilities:  
- Walk dogs, ensuring their safety and well-being - Follow specific instructions provided regarding the pets' needs and preferences - Monitor pets for any signs of distress or health issues - Clean up after pets and dispose of waste properly - Maintain a professional and friendly demeanor when interacting with clients and their pets - Send picture updates to the clients and myself after every appointment - Communicate any concerns or observations to me

Requirements:  
- Must possess a phone that can take pictures - Excellent customer service skills and the ability to communicate effectively with clients - Reliable transportation to travel to different locations for appointments -Please be reliable, trustworthy, honest, empathetic, and a hard worker! Being an animal lover is a must! -Someone that can work year round **- Previous professional animal experience**

title: Photo & Video Internship
description:
Professional Commercial Photographer andVideo Director/Producer, in NYC, (http://jillphotography.com) shooting video, editorial, portraiture, and headshots, is seeking fabulous interns for at least one-two days per week.

Beginning August/September-December/January.

Things you'll be doing:

Prepping for shoots; scouting, preparing equipment for use, securing equipment rentals, best practices for lighting, tethering and working within the Capture One program prior to, and during, the photo shoots. Video: location scouting, mood boards, SOW's.

Learning posing techniques and directing skills.

Post-Production Workflow: post-shoot equipment care, learning skills within Adobe Photoshop & Perfect Portrait, batch-processing in Lightroom, good editing (color-correction) and cropping choices, utilizing plug-in for Smugmug, creating web pages for sharing/viewing and delivery, archiving footage for copyright registration, outputting imagery, and learning shoot-specific, social media curation.

It's great if you are self-motivated.

Hours are not specific... However, we are flexible; best if you could be, too.

title: Registered Dietitian
description:
***Join Our Team of Registered Dietitians at NutraCo!***

Are you a compassionate and driven Registered Dietitian seeking a rewarding career in clinical nutrition?

NutraCo, a leading provider of Clinical Nutrition Services to Long Term Care facilities across the United States, has an exciting opportunity for you!

We are currently seeking a motivated individual to join us as an Onsite Registered Dietitian, located near Union City, NJ. This is a full-time position offering a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.

***Please apply to find out more!***

**Why Choose NutraCo?**

At NutraCo, we pride ourselves on delivering compassionate care with respect and dignity to residents in Long Term Care facilities nationwide. When you join our team, you become part of a supportive environment where your contributions are valued and acknowledged.

*Here are just a few reasons to consider a career with NutraCo:*

* **Room for Growth:** We offer development opportunities and upward mobility within the company, empowering you to advance your career.
* **Collaborative Environment:** Join a network of dedicated dietitians who support and interact with each other, fostering a sense of community and teamwork.
* **Valued Professionalism:** Your work as a professional is highly valued and acknowledged at NutraCo, where your voice is heard, and feedback is encouraged and supported.
* **Clear Expectations**: We provide clear goals, directives, and feedback, ensuring you have the resources and support needed to excel in your role.
* **Opportunity for Relocation:** With multiple locations throughout the United States, NutraCo offers the flexibility to relocate if needed, allowing you to grow with us wherever life takes you.

***Responsibilities:***

As a Registered Dietitian at NutraCo, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of our residents by addressing nutrition-related health problems through clinical nutrition treatment.

*Your responsibilities will include:*

* Providing compassionate care and support to residents, focusing on their nutritional needs and well-being.
* Collaborating with other dietitians and facility clinical team to deliver personalized nutrition plans and ensure the highest level of care.
* Completing necessary clinical assessments, charting within the EMR system, and attending meetings to discuss resident care and progress.
* Conducting meal rounds if/as needed, completing sanitation audits, and signing off on dietary menus to maintain quality standards.

***Requirements:***

*To succeed in this role, you must meet the following requirements:*

* Registered Dietitian with the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) or Registration Eligible with a Verification Statement
* State licensure guidelines must be met, along with facility vaccination requirements as needed.
* Strong communication skills, effective teamwork, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly regulated environment.

**Salary and Benefits Offered Include:**

* Competitive salaries starting at $70,000/yr. DOE
* Comprehensive Benefits Package Options Include:
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance options,
* Company Managed 401(k) Program
* Paid Time Off
* Company Paid Holidays
* Continuing Education Credits
* Life and Disability Insurance Options
* Employee Discounts.

*Are you a dedicated Registered Dietitian looking to join a supportive team and make a difference in the lives of residents?* ***We want to hear from you!***

***Apply now*** *to join NutraCo and embark on a rewarding career journey in clinical nutrition!*

title: Pharmacy Technician
description:
**A Day in the Life:**

As a Pharmacy Technician, you have the opportunity to be a part of something bigger. You will be a member of a team supporting our pharmacies, pharmacists, and communities. You create an easy, friendly, and exciting pharmacy experience for your patients. As a Pharmacy Technician, you make our pharmacy a great place for your friends, family, and neighbors to get their prescriptions. When you join our team as a pharmacy technician, you unlock the potential for growth. Through proper training and mentoring you will have the opportunity to promote and provide immunizations (where allowed by law) to help keep our patients safe in the communities we serve.


Whether you’re looking for your first part-time job, returning to work after some time off, or want a full-time career, our company has amazing job opportunities waiting for you. Albertsons will train you to become a pharmacy technician offering classes from our pharmacy learning and development team, pharmacy computer system and hands-on training with our teams.


**Bring your flavor:**

Building the future of food and well-being starts with you. Join our team and bring your best self to the table. Applications are accepted on an on-going basis.  



**What you bring to the table:**

· You have or are willing to obtain proper licenses (where required by local state requirements)


· You thrive in a fast-paced environment


· You take pride in the work you do, whether big or small.


· You believe that food is central to all our lives.


· Helping customers and fellow associates gives you energy.


· Smiling and making others smile is your favorite.


· You are eager, willing, and wanting to learn & grow.


· You believe that being a part of your community matters.  



**Why you will choose us:**

Albertsons Companies Inc. has always been a people-oriented business, and thoughtful people practices remain a core element of our company’s philosophy. Our goal is to continue to bring people together around the joys of food and to inspire well-being and that starts with people like you bringing your unique self to our company and making it one person stronger and better!


We also provide a variety of benefits including:


· Diverse & Inclusive Work Culture


· Competitive Wages Paid Weekly


· Flexible work schedules


· Associate discounts


· Leaders invested in your training, career growth & development


· Health and welfare benefits for eligible employees (Medical, Dental, 401k and more!)


· Vacation / Paid Time Off


**Our Values:**

· We put people first


· We are customer-driven


· We value different perspectives


· We raise the bar


· We act as owners


· We are one team


· We build belonging


· We are committed to a healthy future

.

title: New Business Account Executive
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 2 years of experience in full life-cycle sales.
* Experience in developing relationships with new customers and serving as a consultant.
* Experience in sales development.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience in building a book of business, ensuring the management and fulfillment of strategic goals, and developing associated agreements.
* Experience in educating new advertisers on the benefits of transitioning from traditional media to digital marketing strategies.
* Experience in exceeding quota attainment.
* Knowledge of the online advertising industry.
* Ability to work in an ambiguous team environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to provide comprehensive advertising solutions to prospective clients.

**About the job**
-----------------


Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.



Google’s New Business Sales team is a group of professionals whose focus is on engaging and obtaining advertisers, and subsequently persuading them to incorporate Google's range of marketing products (e.g., YouTube, Google Ads, and the Google Display Network) into their current Marketing strategies. This global and dedicated team is the engine behind Google’s continued growth.


Google Customer Solutions (GCS) sales teams are trusted advisors and competitive sellers who maintain a relentless focus on customer success by bringing the best Google has to offer to small- and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), which are the backbone of our communities. As a member of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with company owners and make a real difference in their businesses by helping them grow. Together, we help shape the future of innovation for customers, partners, and sellers...and we have fun doing it.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $85,500-$125,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.


Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.
**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Manage the business pipeline and develop a strategy for long-term sustained success.
* Secure new Google Ads clients by presenting marketing solutions, and create relevant ad campaigns that maximize their returns.
* Develop business strategies that optimize the market potential.
* Understand customer needs and requirements.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

description:
**About us**

Union Plaza Care Center is a 280 bed skilled nursing facility located in the heart of Flushing, NY. Our facility is dedicated to providing exceptional care to our residents and community. Union Plaza Care Center is a 5 Star rated facility and a 2024 Best Nursing Home aware recipient. Our facility has been serving the needs for Flushing, NY for over 20 years.

As the Director of Nursing, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of nursing care within our organization. This includes coordinating and supervising nursing staff, ensuring compliance with healthcare regulations, and providing exceptional patient care. Responsibilities: - Develop and implement nursing policies and procedures to ensure high-quality patient care - Manage and supervise nursing staff, including hiring, training, and evaluating performance - Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to develop and implement patient care plans - Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of nursing interventions and adjust as necessary - Ensure compliance with all healthcare regulations and standards - Oversee documentation review to ensure accuracy and completeness - Coordinate with doctors and other healthcare providers to ensure seamless patient care - Manage shift schedules to ensure adequate staffing levels at all times - Provide guidance and support to nursing staff in complex patient care situations - Stay up-to-date with advancements in nursing practices and technologies Skills: - Strong knowledge of home care, assisted living, home health, acute care, and Medicare regulations - Excellent leadership skills with the ability to effectively manage a team - Proficient in shift management and resource allocation - In-depth understanding of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology - Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written - Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities - Detail-oriented with excellent documentation review skills We offer competitive compensation packages including benefits such as health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off, and professional development opportunities. The Parent Aide will provide in-home support and guidance to parents to improve their parenting skills, enhance family functioning, and ensure the safety and well-being of children. This position is part of the Exchange Parent Aide Program, which aims to strengthen families through parent education, support, and case management in the homes of at-risk families.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct regular home visits for a caseload of 12-15 clients.
* Conduct family-centered assessments and maintain a family plan, focused on enhancing parenting skills.
* Maintain accurate records.
* Assist with community resources.
* Attend case conferences with DCPP and attend staff meetings.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in social work or related field with at least one year’ experience working with families. However, ***Parent Aides may possess a DED or High School Diploma with 3-5 years’ experience providing direct care to minors and/or related experience in the child welfare system.***
* Candidates with lived experience must have the demonstrated ability to advocate within the system while maintaining appropriate diplomacy while modeling these skills to families being served.
* Must have the ability to work with diverse populations
* Ability to work independently, with effective communication skills, and a valid driver’s license in good standing are also required.
* Evening and weekend work may be required.

title: Housekeeping Attendant
description:
Current Cleaning Co. is urgently hiring part-time to full-time housekeepers. This locally-owned small business requires enthusiastic, reliable, and hard-working employees who will uphold standards that exceed client expectations and propel forward the modern techniques that ensure both our clients and our employees can have peace of mind. Current is always seeking to go above and beyond, with all-natural cleaning products and waste-reducing procedures, we remain conscious of the environment both inside and outside of our clients’ properties, to keep every household and our housekeepers happy and safe! If you are seeking a rewarding, low-pressure, and fulfilling position, you could be a perfect addition to the Current team!

**Description:**

Housekeeping attendants with Current Cleaning Co. travel within the following New Jersey counties: Middlesex, Somerset, and Union. Each cleaning takes approximately 2-5 hours depending on the size and condition of the home as well as the particular cleaning needs as specified by the client(s). Due to occasional schedule adjustments by our clients, housekeeping attendants can expect to complete one or two cleanings per day 3-5 days a week, with optional weekends. This dynamic schedule is perfect for extra morning/early afternoon work if you currently have a night job and are seeking additional income. Training housekeeping attendants follow a customized checklist during each cleaning to ensure each task has been completed and will be required to complete cleaning tasks in residential buildings that include bathrooms, kitchens, living rooms, bedrooms, etc. As this is still a growing small business, more and more shifts become available with new clients. Bi-weekly or weekly cleanings are most often scheduled with us, but there are occasional monthly or one-time cleanings to be completed as well. During each shift, employees will be compensated for gas usage if a personal vehicle is used to reach the cleaning location. Paid training.

**Job Requirements:**

* NO experience required! We will happily train you to meet our clients’ needs.
* Ability to work on your feet for 2-6 hours at a time
* Ability to lift at most 15-20 pounds
* Basic cleaning knowledge and abilities - we will do the rest!
* **Reliable transportation required**
* 18+ years of age preferred

We are looking for dedicated, detail-oriented individuals with the willingness to learn and grow with us; your resume is preferred (not required) but we are much more interested in the personal abilities and characteristics that will make you a great fit for the team. We can't wait to hear from you!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $16.00 - $17.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 35 per week

Benefits:

* Fuel reimbursement
* On-the-job training
* Paid training

Schedule:

* Day shift
* No nights
* On call

* Do you have any cleaning experience? Please provide any relevant details that you feel may be important to add.
* Would you be open to working more shifts as they become available? These shifts may be one-time cleanings or recurring cleanings on a weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly basis.
* Housekeeping Attendants may be required to drive up to 40 minutes to reach a client's home, depending on your location. Would you be willing to drive such a distance with gas compensation? (For your reference, our current clients are based in the following cities: Summit, Westfield, Springfield, Warren, Garwood, and South Plainfield)
* Please enter your current availability for work (Example: Mondays 9-5, Tuesday mornings, etc.) for future scheduling purposes, as well as the earliest date you will be available to start.

title: Business Development Representative - Aesthetic & Wellness Market
description:
**Outside Sales Representative (NYC) - Aesthetic & Wellness Market – T-Shape 2**

***About the Product***  
T-Shape 2 is the top selling device from Italy for Cellulite and Skin Tightening.

We recently launched in the US following FDA clearance.

We have a very compelling business offer - where we will cover the payments of the device for the first year and then guarantee payback in following years.

***Our Website***  
www.artemis.co  
***Our Deal***  
https://artemis.co/devices/t-shape2

***About the Position***

Min wage basic salary.

Ability to earn $5,000 per month on top of basic.

Uncapped commissions.

We are seeking outbound salespeople in the Aesthetic & Wellness market to sell a high-growth body contouring system to beauty/wellness professionals.

You would visit med spa locations by visiting them and then arranging follow up meetings with our team.

1 year of sales experience is required.

**Responsibilities and Duties**

We're looking for a dedicated salesperson to drive sales and deliver scalable, predictable revenue growth for this exciting product.

You will be visiting clients door-to-door and will be out of the office at least 4 days a week.

**Ideal Behavior**

In our experience there are three types of salespeople:

1. The lazy, unmotivated, who believe they can get by on just charm and quick wit. Perhaps somewhat naturally talented but do not commit to being a student of the game and will ultimately burn out, out of either boredom or termination.

2. The hustler, often disorganized, but has an immensely high activity and generally can overcome a lack of skill by sheer force of volume of output.

3. The capable and tenacious, quietly modest, oriented around humility and devoted to obsessive improvement and betterment of their craft. Realizing they don't have all the answers and are hungry to grow, learn, and earn.

We're looking for #3

**Qualifications and Skills**

What we're looking for:

· 1 Year of sales experience with experience of in-person / door-to-door selling

· Self-motivated and independent.

· Warm personality

· Outstanding organizational and relationship nurturing skills.

· Positive, adaptive, goal-driven, resilient, tenacious follow-up skills, persuasive, & self-motivated.

**Requirements:**

· Diligence in keeping up with your leads, ensuring minimal speed to lead time.

· Excellent verbal and written communication.

· Strong customer satisfaction orientation.

· Ability to open new accounts despite obstacles and build a steady pipeline of business.

· Ability to meet and exceed prospecting and pipeline development goals.

· Maintain updated knowledge of products, market conditions, and competitor strategies.

· Proficiency in G-Suite products.

· Skill with CRM programs, Outreach, and other sales productivity tools.

Additional things that would make you present more awesome:

· Door-to-door sales experience.

· Experience in the aesthetic, spa, and/or wellness space.

**Benefits**

We offer you:

· A quick 1-3 month ramp up and continued management support without babysitting KPIs. You have 1 activity KPI & your quota, achieve those and you dictate your workflow.

· This is a full-time position

· Healthcare

**About Artemis Distribution** 

Artemis distribution brings today’s top beauty devices to the US market with the aim of building a community of successful entrepreneurs who empower their clients to be confident in their own skin.

*\\* Artemis Distribution is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Legislative Fellow
description:
The New York City Council Fellows Program is a one-year paid fellowship for individuals who want to pursue a rewarding career in local government. The program provides fellows with a unique opportunity to work in one of the most diverse and exciting cities in the country. With Council Member district offices in each New York City borough and centralized support divisions located in downtown Manhattan, fellows will participate in many vibrant programs and impactful service-oriented initiatives in both locations.

This fellowship will provide up-close experience in legislative operations, community engagement projects, capital programs, participatory budgeting, public policy and more, helping us to shape the next generation of New York City government leaders.

Fellows Program Year: October 7, 2024 to September 26, 2025

**SALARY RANGE**:

$40,000 to $40,000

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Ability to commit full-time to the one year fellowship.
* Must have completed a bachelor’s degree at time of application submission.
* Must be able to demonstrate their eligibility to work in the United States after graduation and for the entire fellowship period.
* Prior experience in activism, community organizing, development or participation in social movements helpful.
* Demonstrated proficiency in both written and spoken English.
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong time and task management skills.
* Working knowledge of computers and related software.
* Highly motivated and independent, yet team-oriented.

**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:**

New York City residency required within 90 days of appointment.

Health, dental and vision insurance coverage are offered upon appointment. Retirement plans, deferred compensation plans, group life insurance, paid time off and paid holidays, training resources, health & fitness reimbursement and wellness programs are also available.

The New York City Council makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact EEOOfficer@council.nyc.gov.

title: Inmate Support Specialist
description:
**About Us:**

We are a compassionate nonprofit organization dedicated to supporting incarcerated individuals and their families through difficult times. Our mission is to provide comprehensive assistance, from legal support to emotional guidance, ensuring that families have the resources they need to navigate the complexities of the justice system. We are expanding our team and are looking for a motivated and empathetic Inmate Support Specialist to join us.

**Job Overview:**

We are seeking a Inmate Support Specialist with a background in sales and customer service. The ideal candidate will excel in providing compassionate support to families, especially in court settings, while confidently guiding them through the legal process. This role is essential in building trust and maintaining strong relationships with the families of incarcerated individuals, ensuring they receive the best possible support.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Serve as the primary point of contact for families of incarcerated individuals, offering support and guidance throughout the legal process.
* Work closely with families in court settings, providing them with necessary information, and resources.
* Utilize sales experience to confidently present options for legal support services to families, helping them understand the value of available resources.
* Demonstrate empathy and understanding in all interactions, ensuring that families feel heard and supported during challenging times.
* Collaborate with legal teams to gather and provide accurate information to families, ensuring they are fully informed about their loved one’s case.
* Maintain detailed records of all interactions with families, ensuring that all support provided is documented and organized.
* Participate in ongoing training to stay updated on legal processes and best practices for supporting incarcerated individuals and their families.
* Advocate for the needs of families and work to ensure their concerns are addressed in a timely and effective manner.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in sales and customer service, preferably in a legal or nonprofit setting.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present information confidently and clearly to families.
* Demonstrated empathy and the ability to connect with people in emotionally challenging situations.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team, managing multiple cases and priorities effectively.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to maintain accurate records.
* Previous experience working in a court setting or with incarcerated individuals and their families is a plus.

title: Laboratory Researcher IV
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Laboratory Researcher IV
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** Engn- Ctr Adv Infrastructure
  

**Overview**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is a leading national research university and the State of New Jersey’s preeminent, comprehensive public institution of higher education. As one of the largest employers in the State of New Jersey, Rutgers University is committed not only to the students and the State that we serve, but also to the faculty and staff who work on our campuses.  

For two consecutive years, Rutgers is ranked on Forbes’ list of America’s Best Large Employers. Rutgers holds #64 of 500 employers and is the #1 New Jersey employer on the publication’s 2023 list. Rutgers’ commitment to its employees includes maintaining and fostering a safe, diverse, and respectful workplace environment, creating employment opportunities for our nation’s military veterans, and ensuring accessibility and accommodation for individuals with disabilities.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Laboratory Researcher IV for the School of Engineering. Reports directly to the Supervisor of the Rutgers University Asphalt/Pavement Laboratory (RAPL) within the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering at Rutgers University.  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Supports pavement-related research activities under the Center for Advanced Infrastructure and Transportation (CAIT) at Rutgers University.
* Must have the working knowledge of hot mix asphalt design and laboratory testing related to its performance in the field.
* Must have an understanding of pavement construction practices.
* Performs professional entry level research experiments and research using various asphalt and pavement evaluation-based techniques.
* Carries out routine and non-routine work with review of work outputs by the Laboratory Supervisor.
* Operates and maintains highly specialized equipment, in addition to maintaining and keeping the work place (laboratory) organized, clean, and calibrated.
* Trains and leads students and lower level technicians through various established testing procedures and should have some experience doing so.
* Completes work under the direct supervision of the Laboratory Supervisor, with specific instructions on routine and semi-routine work and/or within established work parameters.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 066071.00
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 079941.00
  

**Standard Hours** 37.50
  

**Union Description** Admin Assembly (MPSC)
  

**Payroll Designation** ABP
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility**  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* A minimum of a Bachelors Degree in a scientific field or an equivalent combination of education and/or relevant research and hot mix asphalt materials experience.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
* Use of personal vehicle in order to travel for business demands; a valid driver’s license would be required for this position.


  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Computer literacy, especially Microsoft Excel and Word.
* Must be mechanically knowledgeable since many of the testing equipment will need routine maintenance and calibration.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Certifications in other types of hot mix asphalt design.
* Experience working in a university laboratory/field research setting related to civil engineering.
* Familiarity with roadway design and construction practices.
* Level 1 and Level 2 New Jersey Society of Asphalt Technologists (NJSAT) certification in Hot Mix Asphalt Design and Hot Mix Asphalt Plant Technician.


  

**Equipment Utilized**
* Servo-pneumatic test systems: In particular, a piece of test equipment called the Asphalt Pavement Analyzer.
* Gyratory compactors, vibratory compactors, and impact hammer compactors which are commonly used in the asphalt industry for design and preparation of performance testing.
* NCAT Ignition Ovens used for the determination of a paving mixtures asphalt content.
* Software: Important
* PinePave: An Excel based design program used for the design and aggregate blending of materials used to design Hot Mix Asphalt.
* Excel: A basic knowledge of the use of Excel is mandatory. This software is not only used for design purposes, but is also used for many of the mathematical computations, statistical analysis, and empirical modeling required in the position.
* Word: A basic knowledge of the use of Word (or any equivalent word processing software) is mandatory. Due to the research nature of the work, any relevant findings from the research will be organized and sent out to peer review publications. Therefore, both report writing and journal publications will be constructed.
* Materials: Important
* Hot Mix Asphalt: This encompasses the aggregates (stone and sand), as well as liquid asphalt binder.
* Soils and Aggregates: This encompasses raw materials in the laboratory, as well as materials being sampled from the field to be analyzed in the lab.


  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* The position has numerous physical activities, some that require the moving and lifting of heavy materials, so the applicant should be in good physical health.
* Must be able to read and understand technical documents, operate scientific instruments and computers, perform detailed work and manage multiple tasks.


  

**Special Conditions**
Clean Driving Record.  

*

title: Student Assistant (Tutor)
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Student Assistant (Tutor)
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Student Affairs and Services
  

**Department** SHP-Dean's office-Admin
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.
Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.
Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.
Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers School of Health Professions (SHP) – Office of Enrollment Management is seeking Student Assistants (Tutors) to provide support to students from a range of multiple disciplines in the Health Professions field. The Student Assistant will bridge the gap between the college and the needs of the student and help students make academic progress while promoting independent learning and self-reliance. The department is currently seeking twelve (12) student assistants/tutors.  

  

Essential duties and responsibilities include the following:* Assists the Office of Enrollment Management with various data collection and reporting with respect to tutor usage and student progress.
* Provides academic assistance to assigned tutees, either in a group or individually.
* Maintains records on each student who is being tutored, including follow-up and periodic assessment.
* Helps students develop positive attitudes toward learning and studying and help students develop a high level of motivation in academic areas.
* Assists students in achieving a better understanding of specific subject material and in improving academic capabilities in designated areas.
* Attends periodic training sessions given by staff members to increase competency in working with students.
* Collaborates with Enrollment Management Student Advisor and provides feedback regarding student progress.
* Understands and adheres to Rutgers’ compliance standards as they appear in RBHS’s Corporate Compliance Policy, Code of Conduct and Conflict of Interest Policy.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Financial Analyst
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Finance/Accounting/Purchasing
  

**Department** UBHC-Acctg & Financial Reporting
  

**Overview**
Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care (UBHC), established in 1971, offers a full continuum of evidence based behavioral health and addiction services for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors throughout New Jersey. UBHC’s 1,060 experienced behavioral health professionals and support staff are dedicated to treatment, prevention, and education. UBHC, one of the largest providers of behavioral health care in the country, has a budget of $260 million and has 15 sites throughout New Jersey. Services are readily accessible and include: inpatient, outpatient, partial hospitalization, screening, crisis stabilization, family/caregiver support, community outreach and case management, supportive housing, supported employment, prevention and consultation, employee assistance programs, and a licensed therapeutic school from preschool through high school. Specialty services include the New Jersey suicide prevention helpline and peer help lines for police, veterans, active military, teachers, mothers of special needs children and child protective service workers. In FY2016, UBHC treated 16,199 consumers, had 24,502 admissions, and touched the lives of 19,441 individual callers through peer support. In addition, UBHC is the primary mental health training resource for the New Jersey departments of Human Services, Children and Families, and Corrections, delivering 16,000 trainings each year.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Financial Analyst for the Finance – Accounting Department within Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care.  

  

The primary purpose of the Financial Analyst is to be responsible for performing advanced accounts analysis and reconciliations. Develops, interprets and implements financial accounting concepts for financial planning and control. Prepares journal entries in a manner acceptable under the principles of accounting practices and theory.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:  

* Prepares correspondence and statistical, financial, and other reports containing findings, conclusions, and recommendations.
* Ensures smooth and timely year-end and other periodic audits.
* Analyzes budget variances on a regular basis.
* Prepares and distributes invoices to UBCH/UCHC clients.
* Assists in the workflow of Purchase Requisitions and Personnel Action Forms.
* Assists with Sponsored Projects.
* Supports a working environment to achieve annual goals and objectives.
* Participates and contributes to the smooth functioning and operation of the Department.

title: Cabinet Installer
description:
**UPDATE: Due to increased demand in our area, we are once again expanding our Installation department and are looking for immediate hires to join our team! Previous applicants need not apply.**   
*\\**\\*\\*

**Are you team-oriented, fun, hard-working, customer-focused, and looking to join an amazing organization?** If so, we are looking for full-time, hard-working, and customer-focused installers to join the California Closets Team! We install locally manufactured custom storage systems in northern New Jersey and eastern Pennsylvania. If you have experience with carpentry or in-home installations of any kind, we want to hear from you!

\\*\\*\\*

**JOB SUMMARY**

Based on provided designs and components, construct, erect, install, and repair custom storage systems and accessories using laminate wood, edge-banding, hardware and other materials, requiring your skills with hand tools and power tools. Training is provided.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

1. Perform skilled and semi-skilled carpentry work to install custom storage systems such as closets, cabinets, offices, and other spaces in the home or commercial buildings.

2. Utilize company provided CAD drawings\\blueprints to properly and efficiently install systems.

3. Assemble and install systems of varying complexity.

4. Assists in the removal and installation of materials in customer homes.

5. Maintain shop tools and equipment in safe working order. Tools are provided.

6. Install systems independently or with team members depending on the size of the job.

7. Provide a high level of customer service for in-home installations.

8. Install materials safely and maintain safety standards at all times.

9. Responsible for driving to and from customer sites and maintaining company provided vehicles in a safe manner. Report any vehicle problems to the company immediately.

10. Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned by supervisor.

**Qualifications:**

* Must maintain valid drivers license and clean driving record
* High School diploma
* Experience with common hand and power tools
* Trade or vocational school experience desirable
* Cabinetry or carpentry skills desirable
* Strong verbal and written communication and listening skills
* Able to provide high level of customer service
* Able to work individually and in teams
* Able to meet the physical demands of the position

Including:

* Able to walk, lift 50 pounds, reach, stoop, stand, grasp, balance, climb stairs, kneel, and crouch
* Able to work in various inside and outside environments being subjected to weather, noise, sawdust and other external factors
* Requires visual acuity for depth perception and color perception
* Visually inspect and report or fix small defects and/or minor measuring mistakes
* Able to use a variety of measuring devices and tools provided by the company
* Able to assemble or fabricate parts at or within arm’s length
* Able to operate machines, motor vehicles, hand tools, and job specific equipment and tools
* Able to determine the accuracy and thoroughness of work
* Able to hear sufficiently to accurately perceive information at normally spoken word levels
* Able to use communication by means of spoken word to express or exchange ideas

* Dental insurance

* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift

We are seeking a skilled Event Manager to coordinate exceptional events. The role encompasses all event facets from planning to post-event assessment. The ideal candidate must possess strong organizational skills and oversee the promotion, procurement, and execution of top-notch catering services for our upscale steakhouse. Beyond administrative tasks, this position entails active outreach to secure new business opportunities, employing creative methods to attract clients while nurturing existing relationships. Effective communication and meticulousness will distinguish standout applicants. The objective is to orchestrate memorable events that both entertain attendees and advance business aims. The Event Manager guides clients through event journeys, tailoring solutions to align with their objectives, culminating in a remarkable event experience.

Key Job Responsibilities

* Effectively prepare and present quotes and proposals in a timely manner for all inquiries.
* Proactively solicit new business through networking, cold-calling, marketing/mailings, and sample drops.
* Drive new relationships with businesses/clients (law firms, doctor’s offices, hospitals, pharmaceutical reps, etc.) to build an active list of accounts.
* Understand the overall market - competitors' strengths and weaknesses, economic trends, supply and demand, etc. and ability to competitively sell against them.
* Attending site visits and appropriate venue meetings as necessary to support the customer event experience.
* Understand event cost structure and incorporate this into solution designs according to established profitability guidelines.
* Understand requirements for each event
* Plan event with attention to financial and time constraints
* Negotiate to achieve the most favorable terms
* Manage all event operations
* Do final checks at the day of the event (e.g., tables, menus, BEO's, scheduled staff, etc.) to ensure everything meets standards
* Oversee event happenings and act quickly to resolve problems
* Evaluate event’s success and submit reports

Relationship Management

* Deliver World-Class Service by cultivating and maintaining relationships with customers, venue personnel and various supporting functions and departments.
* Thoroughly research and understand customer history and previous experiences, to create more personalized customer experiences.
* Value People by attending customer meetings, understanding their goals, and responding to their questions, concerns, and challenges.
* Do the Right Thing by ensuring all customer information is up to date and accurate at all times.
* Actively refer and guide customers through the Nusret network, leveraging contacts to secure additional opportunities with existing customers.

Sales Accountability

* Always maintain a healthy pipeline that ensures achievement of established revenue targets.
* See the Big Picture by supporting the sales forecasting efforts at home location, ensuring they are accurate and submitted timely.
* Learn and adopt all SOPs related to the role and any new initiatives/programs that are implemented.
* Maintain knowledge of new product/service offerings and emerging technology supporting meetings and events.

Job Qualifications

* BS/BA or 4+ years of equivalent experience required
* Knowledge of hospitality industry and sales processes preferred
* Technical aptitude and computer proficiency required
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Brand knowledge and familiarity with all products offered.

Competencies

* Hospitality
* Responsiveness
* Professionalism
* Decision Quality
* Business Insight
* Collaborates
* Builds Networks
* Plans and Aligns
* Instills Trust
* Demonstrates Self-Awareness

Job Type: Full-time

title: Supported Employment Specialist
description:
Position Title: Supported Employment Specialist Department: Employment

Reports to: Supported Employment Manager

Essential Functions:

The Employment Specialist supports people in mental health recovery to find, get and keep competitive employment of their choice, utilizing a proven evidence-based practice. The Specialist carries a caseload of 20 program participants at any point in time.

Scope:

Identify opportunities for competitive employment for assigned clients and provide the supports necessary to assist individuals in obtaining and maintaining his/her/their own goals related to employment.

Position Responsibilities:

* Provide vocational counseling and career exploration, while focusing on an individual’s mental health, for a caseload of 20 individuals in recovery through weekly meetings in the community, at the Resource Center (Stamford) or via zoom..
* Help program participants build skills related to their employment goal, including resume/cover letter writing, interview preparation and job searching.
* Establish and maintain relationships with employers and prospective employers in the community to develop job opportunities to meet the needs and employment preferences of program participants.
* Maintain data entry for client meetings, goals, progress notes, milestones and outcomes in SalesForce database and recovery goal plans in client charts.
* Provide direct service in accordance with contractual guidelines (Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services - DMHAS) to meet or exceed outcome fidelity measures.
* Collaborate with Bureau of Rehabilitation Services (BRS) for additional vocational services and consultation as needed for particular clients.
* Maintain communication with other providers on the individual’s mental health support team, collaborating with clinicians, case managers, care coordinators, educational representatives and employers.
* Facilitate transportation to work site as needed (Company car available) during the initial hiring process for the client and transition client to self-sufficiency.

Supervisory Responsibilities (if any):

* N/A

Knowledge and Skills Required

* Ability to work well as a member of a team.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and work independently; self-motivated and takes initiative.
* Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.
* Good oral and written communication skills.
* Outgoing, engaging clients in their own recovery with active listening and empathy.
* Ability to motivate and inspire others and lead by example.
* Ability to promote community based independence through skill building, participant engagement and constructive feedback as appropriate.
* Ability to maintain appropriate boundaries with program participants.
* Ability to document according to state and federal guidelines and comply with policies (e.g., HIPAA) and procedures.
* Computer literacy in use of MS Office products, email, internet and familiarity with standard database applications. Ability to use video conferencing tools such as Zoom and TEAMS to conduct virtual meetings.
* Proficiency in Spanish a plus, but not required.

Minimum Requirements:

* Bachelors in social work, mental health counseling, human services, or rehabilitative services such as employment, education, or related field.
* Minimum of 1 year relevant work experience.
* Must successfully pass the pre-employment drug test and background check.
* Must possess a valid driver’s license and have and maintain a safe driving record.

To apply for this position please send your **cover letter** and resume to coverlettersandresumes@laurelhouse.net.

*Laurel House, Inc. is a 501(c) (3) nonprofit organization that helps individuals and families achieve and sustain mental health to lead fulfilling lives in the community. Our core purpose is social inclusion, early intervention and recovery. Laurel House is an equal opportunity employer. Laurel House and www.rtor.org, a free service of Laurel House connecting families to expert mental health treatment, are committed to the advancement of racial equity and social justice, and to making mental health services accessible to all.* *Laurel House is fully compliant with all COVID-19 restrictions for the workplace and for interactions with other employees*, *clients and visitors.*

title: Insurance and Wealth Management Advisor
description:
**As a Financial Representative you will work with individuals and businesses in your community, providing access to financial products and services that will protect their assets, help them understand their financial life, and build wealth for the future.**

**What you’ll be doing…**  
· Work with clients to understand their goals, concerns, and current financial information.  
Analyze information to create a plan with appropriate strategies, products, and services.  
· Develop and maintain relationships with a base of clients who value your input and guidance.  
· Work with clients to keep their financial plans current and aligned with their goals, building relationships with clients that will last for years.

**Our Commitment…**  
· Mutual Respect – We want clients to advocate for themselves. We also know the process can vary for each client. As a team member, you’ll understand how to engage and empathize with clients while drawing on knowledge that breaks through the noise with clarity of purpose to build better financial futures.  
· Doing the Right Thing – We invite constructive and productive conversations across our firm and with our clients. Feedback can be difficult, and it is integral to your continued growth and development.  
· Community Involvement – We believe in building community through philanthropy. Team members answer the call of charitable service by partnering with nationally recognized non-profits, including but not limited to United Way and Habitat for Humanity.

· Must be willing and able to obtain appropriate insurance licensing (Life & Health  
Producer)

· You desire to help others achieve their goals and dreams through cultivating long-term relationships.  
· You are ambitious, entrepreneurial, and looking for career growth and development.

**Preferred Qualifications:**  
· Life Producer Licensed

· A four‐year college degree

**Benefits**:

Our Managing Directors provide 18 to 24 months of one-on-one training while offering certification and licensing opportunities to help you become established as a trusted financial advisor.  
· Mentorship and joint-work opportunities.  
· Leadership and career development opportunities including tuition reimbursement and continuing education opportunities.
